item.title: Sasha Johnson: Man, 18, appears in court over activist's shooting
item.description: Cameron Deriggs, 18, is charged with conspiracy to murder the black equal rights activist.

item.title: Canada mourns as remains of 215 children found at indigenous school
item.description: The mass grave was found during a survey of the former residential school for indigenous people.

item.title: Champions League final: How to follow Man City v Chelsea on the BBC
item.description: As Manchester City prepare to meet Chelsea in Porto, all you need to know about Saturday's all-English Champions League final.

item.title: San Jose shooting: Guns, petrol and 22,000 rounds of ammunition found
item.description: A search of the man's home reveals 12 guns, Molotov cocktails and thousands of rounds of ammunition.

item.title: Comedy of errors in Argentine TV Shakespeare mix-up
item.description: An Argentine TV presenter confuses the Immortal Bard with a British namesake who died this week.

item.title: CCTV shows Khan before he carried out the attack
item.description: CCTV and other footage shown at the inquest shows Usman Khan before he carried out the attack.

item.title: Stonewall boss defends new strategy amid criticism
item.description: Nancy Kelley says she is excited about its path despite claims it is taking an "extremist stance".

item.title: Duchess of Cambridge gets first Covid vaccine dose
item.description: Catherine says she is "hugely grateful" to everyone who is playing a part in the vaccine rollout.

item.title: North Korea says children volunteering on mines and farms
item.description: State news reports the orphans want "to repay even just a millionth of the love the party showed".

item.title: Windermere engagement ring find freediver 'a brilliant man'
item.description: A couple pay tribute to Angus Hosking, who located their ring after it fell into Windermere.

item.title: Sri Lanka's beaches swamped with burning ship debris
item.description: Plastic and chemical contamination threatens environment and livelihoods in Sri Lanka.

item.title: Emmys 2021: The binge-worthy TV shows in this year's race
item.description: Ted Lasso, The Queen’s Gambit, The Flight Attendant and I May Destroy You could all be nominated.

item.title: Venezuela's paradise beach resort turns into violent nightmare
item.description: The region of Barlovento in northern Venezuela used to be a perfect Caribbean holiday destination.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Meet the armless archer aiming for gold at the Paralympics
item.description: Matt Stutzman was born without arms and always wanted to be a professional athlete.

item.title: Week in pictures: 22 - 28 May 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Watch: Passenger attacks flight attendant in US
item.description: Incidents of violence or "unruly behaviour" have been on the rise in the US, according to airlines.

item.title: Mantuan roundel: UK places export bar on £17m artefact
item.description: Ministers want the unique 15th Century piece depicting mythical gods to be "saved" for the nation.

item.title: Fishmongers' Hall: Terror attack victims 'touched the lives of so many'
item.description: Inquest jurors concluded that Jack Merritt and Saskia Jones were unlawfully killed at Fishmongers' Hall.

item.title: After a 32-year battle for justice, what is Hillsborough's legacy?
item.description: As the collapse of the last criminal trial marks the end of a long legal road, Judith Moritz asks what the legacy of Britain’s worst sports disaster is.

item.title: George Floyd: After a flood of donations, what next?
item.description: The Minnesota Freedom Fund received $40m in the wake of Floyd's death. What happened after?

item.title: Tetraplegic Steven Webb is elected mayor of Truro
item.description: Steven Webb was paralysed as a teenager and 30 years later has become mayor of his home city.

item.title: Mud cylinders reveal humans' impact on Earth began earlier than we thought
item.description: Researchers have tracked 4,000 years of human influence on the planet - all from long tubes of mud.

item.title: Is Kintyre's 'Route 66' the next road to recovery?
item.description: K66 is being promoted as a new scenic route on and around the Kintyre peninsula in Argyll.

item.title: Champions League final: Dover Athletic face ruin in 'dog eat dog' football world
item.description: English clubs dominate Europe, but Dover Athletic face ruin at the bottom of the football pyramid.

item.title: Celtic in advanced talks with former Australia manager Postecoglou
item.description: Celtic are in advanced negotiations with former Australia head coach Ange Postecoglou with a view to him becoming their new manager.

item.title: How Fernandinho became a Man City legend - but is this his final farewell?
item.description: Fernandinho could end his Manchester City career on the highest of highs in this Saturday's Champions League final against Chelsea - if he decides to leave.

item.title: Evans 'not losing sleep' over Thiem comments as Britons prepare for French Open
item.description: British number one Dan Evans dismisses the suggestion from world number four Dominic Thiem that he is benefiting from the quarantine rules at tournaments.

item.title: Your guide to Spain, Portugal and other holiday hotspots
item.description: What you need to know about travelling abroad to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid Indian variant: Where is it, how does it spread and is it more infectious?
item.description: The Indian variant is spreading in some parts of the country - how serious is it?

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 38 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: People are now being told to minimise travel to eight areas of England where Covid is spreading fast.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Friends reunion: The references that stood the test of time
item.description: The Friends reunion is out - here are the parts of the show that are still spoken about today.

item.title: Bangor Tandoori: Waiter applauded for saving choking customer
item.description: Jake Snelling was given the Heimlich manoeuvre by Sheakh Nazmul Hasan Rifat in Bangor.

item.title: North Yorkshire Police find nine people in uninsured car
item.description: Two female passengers crawled out of the boot during the traffic stop in North Yorkshire.

item.title: Brighton artist turns coma hallucinations into graphic novel
item.description: Zara Slattery had vivid hallucinations during a medical coma while fighting a flesh-eating bug.

item.title: NI 100: The election that allowed a two-year-old to vote
item.description: The goat that changed sides and other lesser-known facts about Northern Ireland’s first parliamentary election.

item.title: Children tell of neglect, filth and fear in US asylum camps
item.description: The BBC has uncovered allegations of cold temperatures, sickness, lice and abuse, through a series of interviews with children and staff at US detention camps for children.

item.title: Rafael Nadal: The 'tough love' that shaped a 20-time Grand Slam champion
item.description: From 'scaredy cat' to a 'raging bull', Rafael Nadal's transformation into a true tennis great has a lot to do with one man in particular.

item.title: Martin Bashir inquiry: Diana, the reporter and the BBC
item.description: The full story of how the BBC's Martin Bashir got his 1995 interview with Princess Diana - and what happened next.
